intro: Oxalis stenoptera var. stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wood sorrel, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features trifoliate leaves with three elliptical leaflets, and small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along streambanks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in native gardens.
